properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Occasional snow squalls are expected. Locations: western Newfoundland. Time span: tonight. Total snowfall accumulations: near 5 cm. Remarks: strong southwesterly winds will combine with periodic snow squalls to produce reduced visibility in blowing snow. Conditions favourable for snow squalls will diminish overnight. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-08T10:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-08T03:17:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2615954988.2021
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong southerly winds will produce near-zero visibilities over these areas today. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-09T01:09:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-08T09:10:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4124417195.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Akulivik, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly winds will reach up to 110 km/h today. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-09T01:10:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-08T09:11:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0381566622.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility, as low as 400 m, in snow and blowing snow will continue tonight. Strong winds with gusts to 80 km/h will continue to reduce the visibility in blowing snow. The winds will begin to ease near midnight tonight bringing an end to the blizzard. Blowing snow may linger into Monday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-08T14:04:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-08T04:18:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0725949964.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada
